title: Is the Big Bang theory still accepted as how the universe was created? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Is the Big Bang theory still accepted as how the universe was created?” The Big Bang theory is not a theory about the creation of the universe, and has never been seen as one by actual scientists in the field. The theory begins with space-time, matter, and energy already in existence, and does not explain where they came from. It is perhaps one of the most misunderstood theories in science. The Big Bang was not an explosion, and there was no center to the expansion. The universe did not originate from a point, and could have been infinitely large to begin with, since the universe could be infinitely large today. It was only the finite portion of the universe we can see from Earth, the observable universe, that once fit into a tiny space.  Here is the evolution of a large section of the universe. The Big Bang is more like the illustration above, which has the past on the left and the present on the right. As time progresses, the universe becomes less dense as gravity pulls matter together into galaxies. The illustration does not go all the way back to the beginning of the Big Bang, just back far enough to see the expansion of space taking place.
